member.name: T:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions
member.summary: request binding options

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.UsePropertyNamingPolicy
member.summary: specify whether to use the json property naming policy when matching incoming field names to dto property names for non-json model binding. only applies when field names are not specified on properties with attributes such as [BindFrom(...)], [FromClaim(...)], [FromHeader(...)] etc.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.UseDefaultValuesForNullableProps
member.summary: by default, if a dto property is nullable and an incoming parameter value is omitted while only the parameter name exists, the default value for the property will be populated. setting false will prevent that from happening. only applies to non-STJ binding paths such as when binding from route/query/claims/headers/form fields etc.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.ReflectionCache
member.summary: the central cache of request dto related reflection data. populating this cache with source generated data will eliminate expression compilations during runtime as well as usage of reflection based property setters, etc. see the source generator documentation on how to populate this cache with generated data.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.FailureMessage
member.summary:
a function used to construct the failure message when a supplied value cannot be successfully bound to a dto property during model binding.
NOTE: this only applies to non-STJ operations. for customizing error messages of STJ binding failures, specify a func.
the following arguments are supplied to the function.
: the type of the property which failed to bind
: the name of the property which failed to bind
: the value that was attempted which resulted in the failure use these input parameters and construct your own error message string and return it from the function.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.JsonExceptionTransformer
member.summary:
by default, all STJ s thrown during deserialization are automatically caught and transformed using this function. if you'd like to disable this behavior, simply set this property to null or specify a function to construct a when STJ throws an exception due to invalid json input.
NOTE: this only applies to STJ based operations. for customizing error messages of non-STJ binding failures, specify a func.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.JsonExceptionStatusCode
member.summary:
this http status code will be used for all automatically sent responses which are built using the
func. defaults to 400.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.FormExceptionTransformer
member.summary: if this function is specified, any internal exceptions that are thrown by asp.net when accessing multipart form data will be caught and transformed to validation failures using this function. by default those exceptions are not caught and thrown out to the middleware pipeline. setting this func might come in handy if you need 413 responses (that arise from incoming request body size exceeding kestrel's MaxRequestBodySize) automatically transformed to 400 problem details responses.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.Modifier
member.summary:
an optional action to be run after the endpoint level request binding has occured. it is intended as a way to perform common model binding logic that applies to all endpoints/requests. the action is passed in the following arguments:
: the request dto instance
: the type of the request dto
: the request binding context
: a cancellation token
WARNING: be mindful of the performance cost of using reflection to modify the request dto object

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.ValueParserFor``1(System.Func{Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringValues,FastEndpoints.ParseResult})
member.summary: add a custom value parser function for any given type which the default model binder will use to parse values when model binding request dto properties from query/route/forms/headers/claims. this is an alternative approach to adding a `TryParse()` function to your types that need model binding support from the abovementioned binding sources. once you register a parser function here for a type, any `TryParse()` method on the type will not be used for parsing. also, these parser functions do not apply to JSON deserialization done by STJ and can be considered the equivalent to registering a custom converter in STJ when it comes to query/route/forms/headers/claims binding sources.
member.typeparam: the type of the class which this parser function will target

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.ValueParserFor(System.Type,System.Func{Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringValues,FastEndpoints.ParseResult})
member.summary: add a custom value parser function for any given type which the default model binder will use to parse values when model binding request dto properties from query/route/forms/headers/claims. this is an alternative approach to adding a `TryParse()` function to your types that need model binding support from the abovementioned binding sources. once you register a parser function here for a type, any `TryParse()` method on the type will not be used for parsing. also, these parser functions do not apply to JSON deserialization done by STJ and can be considered the equivalent to registering a custom converter in STJ when it comes to query/route/forms/headers/claims binding sources.
member.param: the type of the class which this parser function will target

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.BindingOptions.ValueParserWhen(System.Func{System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Boolean},System.Func{System.Object,System.Type,FastEndpoints.ParseResult})
member.summary:
override value parsers for request dto properties that match a predicate.
WARNING: might lead to weird/untraceable behavior. use at own risk!
member.param: a predicate for qualifying a property
the value parser for the matched property type

member.summary: set to true if you'd like the endpoint names/ swagger operation ids to be just the endpoint class names instead of the full names including namespace.

member.summary: set to true if you'd like to automatically prefix endpoint name (swagger operation id) with the first endpoint tag. the generated the operation id would be in the form of: MyTag_CreateOrderEndpoint. this should come in handy with generating separate api clients with nswag using the "MultipleClientsFromOperationId" setting which requires operation ids to be have a group name prefix with an underscore.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointOptions.RoutePrefix
member.summary: prefix for all routes (example 'api').

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointOptions.Filter
member.summary: a function to filter out endpoints from auto registration. the function you set here will be executed for each endpoint during startup. you can inspect the EndpointSettings to check what the current endpoint is, if needed. return 'false' from the function if you want to exclude an endpoint from registration. return 'true' to include. this function will execute for each endpoint that has been discovered during startup.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.Endpoint`2.AccessControl(System.String,System.Nullable{FastEndpoints.Apply},System.String[])
member.summary: if the 'FastEndpoints.Generator' package is used, calling this method will generate a static class called '{assembly-name}.Auth.Allow' with a const field with this that has a 3 digit auto generated value (permission code). doesn't do anything without the source generator package installed.
member.param: the name of the constant field to generate

specify whether to add the generated permission code as a permission requirement for this endpoint. this does the same thing as calling "Permissions(...)" method. i.e. if this optional argument is set to , then a user principal must possess this permission code in order to be allowed access to this endpoint. you don't need to explicitly specify it via a Permissions(...) call, when setting the .

optionally specify one or more groups (sets of permissions) this belongs to. for example if you want to generate a const/key called "Edit_Stock_Item" and want to assign it to an "Admin" group as well as a "Manager" group, you'd specify it with this parameter. The generated const/key is accessible via "Allow.Admin.Edit_Stock_Item" as well as "Allow.Manager.Edit_Stock_Item"

member.param: the name of the constant field to generate

optionally specify one or more groups (sets of permissions) this belongs to. for example if you want to generate a const/key called "Edit_Stock_Item" and want to assign it to an "Admin" group as well as a "Manager" group, you'd specify it with this parameter. The generated const/key is accessible via "Allow.Admin.Edit_Stock_Item" as well as "Allow.Manager.Edit_Stock_Item"

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyConfig.InMemoryCacheSize
member.summary: the in-memory output cache storage size. default value is 1024 mb. when this limit is exceeded, no new responses will be cached until older entries are evicted. this setting will not be applicable if using some other cache store such as redis.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyConfig.MaxResponseBodySize
member.summary: the largest cacheable size of the response body. default is set to 128 mb. if the response body exceeds this limit, it will not be cached.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyConfig.UseCaseSensitivePaths
member.summary: set to true if request paths are case-sensitive. default is to treat paths as case-insensitive.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyExtensions.AddIdempotency(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{FastEndpoints.IdempotencyConfig})
member.summary: enable idempotency features
member.param: global configuration settings for idempotency middleware

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions
member.summary: idempotency settings for an endpoint

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.HeaderName
member.summary: the header name that will contain the idempotency key. defaults to Idempotency-Key

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.AdditionalHeaders
member.summary: any additional headers that should participate in the generation of the cache-key. see the source/definition for the list of default additional headers.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.IgnoreRequestBody
member.summary: by default, the contents of the request body (form data/json) is taken into consideration when determining the uniqueness of incoming requests even if the idempotency-key is the same among them. i.e. if two different requests come in with the same idempotency-key but with different request body content, they will be considered to be unique requests and the endpoint will be executed for each request.
member.remarks: this involves buffering the request body content per each request in order to generate a sha512 hash of the incoming body content. if the clients making requests are under strict quality control and are guaranteed to not reuse idempotency keys, you can set this to true to prevent the hashing of request body content.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.CacheDuration
member.summary: determines how long the cached responses will remain in the cache store before being evicted. defaults to 10 minutes.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.AddHeaderToResponse
member.summary: by default, the idempotency header will be automatically added to the response headers collection. set false to prevent that from happening.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.SwaggerHeaderDescription
member.summary: the description text for the swagger request header parameter

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.SwaggerExampleGenerator
member.summary: a function to generate an example value for the swagger request param header

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IdempotencyOptions.SwaggerHeaderType
member.summary: the type/format of the swagger example value

registers the default global exception handler which will log the exceptions on the server and return a user-friendly json response to the client when unhandled exceptions occur. TIP: when using this exception handler, you may want to turn off the asp.net core exception middleware logging to avoid duplication like so:
"Logging": { "LogLevel": { "Default": "Warning", "Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.ExceptionHandlerMiddleware": "None" } }
member.param: an optional logger instance
set to true if you'd like to log the error in a structured manner
set to true if you don't want to expose the actual exception reason in the json response sent to the client

member.summary:
send a 202 accepted response with a location header containing where the resource can be retrieved from.
HINT: if pointing to an endpoint with multiple verbs, make sure to specify the 'verb' argument and if pointing to a multi route endpoint, specify the 'routeNumber' argument.
WARNING: this overload will not add a location header if you've set a custom endpoint name using .WithName() method. use the other overload that accepts a string endpoint name instead.
member.typeparam: the type of the endpoint where the resource can be retrieved from
member.param: a route values object with key/value pairs of route information
the content to be serialized in the response body
only useful when pointing to a multi verb endpoint
only useful when pointing to a multi route endpoint
json serializer context if code generation is used
set to true for generating an absolute url instead of relative url for the location header
optional cancellation token. if not specified, the HttpContext.RequestAborted token is used.

HINT: if pointing to an endpoint with multiple verbs, make sure to specify the 'verb' argument and if pointing to a multi route endpoint, specify the 'routeNumber' argument.
WARNING: this overload will not add a location header if you've set a custom endpoint name using .WithName() method. use the other overload that accepts a string endpoint name instead.
member.typeparam: the type of the endpoint where the resource can be retrieved from
member.param: the http status code to send
a route values object with key/value pairs of route information
set to true for generating an absolute url instead of relative url for the location header
the content to be serialized in the response body
the content type for the response
only useful when pointing to a multi verb endpoint
only useful when pointing to a multi route endpoint
json serializer context if code generation is used
optional cancellation token. if not specified, the HttpContext.RequestAborted token is used.

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions
member.summary: defines how endpoint discovery and registration should be done at startup

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.Assemblies
member.summary:
an optional collection of assemblies to discover endpoints from in addition to the auto discovered ones. if is set to true, this must be provided.
NOTE: not applicable when using FastEndpoints.Generator package

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.DisableAutoDiscovery
member.summary:
set to true if only the provided Assemblies should be scanned for endpoints. if is null and this is set to true, an exception will be thrown.
NOTE: not applicable when using FastEndpoints.Generator package

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.AssemblyFilter
member.summary:
an optional predicate to filter out the final collection of assemblies before scanning for endpoints.
NOTE: not applicable when using FastEndpoints.Generator package

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.SourceGeneratorDiscoveredTypes
member.summary: when using the FastEndpoints.Generator package, do .AddRange(<AssemblyName>.DiscoveredTypes.All) on this property, per referenced assembly if your solution has multiple projects, or simply assign to this property if there's only one project/assembly. doing so will use the types discovered during source generation instead of reflection based type discovery.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.IncludeAbstractValidators
member.summary: by default only validators inheriting are auto registered. if you'd like to also include validators inheriting , set this to true.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions.Filter
member.summary: a function to filter out types from auto discovery. the function you set here will be executed for each discovered type during startup. return 'false' from the function if you want to exclude a type from discovery. return 'true' to include. alternatively you can annotate the type/class with the to skip auto registration for that type.
